content.question: The figure above shows the graph of the twice-differentiable function <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and the line tangent to the graph of <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at the point <math alttext="with coordinates 0 comma 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. The value of <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 0, of, the fraction with numerator g of x, times e raised to the negative x power, minus 3, and denominator x squared, minus 2 x, end fraction " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> is
